channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023061560
item.description:
Report X-2023061560

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS LOADED TO THE VAN AND TAKEN OUT BY THE DRIVER. DRIVER BROUGHT PACKAGE BACK TO THE DUE TO TOP OF THE BOX BEING WET. DescribePack: CAP LOOSE ON 1 BOTTLE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: CAPS TIGHTENED AND FOLD ABSORD APPLIED TO THE BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023061516
item.description:
Report X-2023061516

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking by the unload when it arrived at the station. Package placed into a lined tote and removed to the hazmat cage for processing DescribePack: It appears that the product leaked via the vented caps due to improper loading and DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fans in the area, placed in a lined sealed tote.

item.title: Report X-2023061187
item.description:
Report X-2023061187

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Somewhere between New Jersey and Missouri the loose cap came off and settled in the bottom of the box. The box was located close to the rear of trailer it was wet and unstable, most of the 20 liters had dried/evaporated leaving minimal clean up per Fedex protocol. DescribePack: The loose allowed 19.5 of 20 Liters to leak out of plastic inner container and allowed wet box to collapse. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Better caps

item.title: Report X-2023061463
item.description:
Report X-2023061463

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T00:35:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-25
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: the package got taken off truck and set aside I guess during that time due to improper packaging the bottles were not sturdy and the lids came loose causing one bottle too leak out. DescribePack: just one loose cap DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: put hazmat in hazmat bag in tote in the designated hazmat section.
